p: The SHUE database comprises a random sample of 246 global cities with populations over 15 000 obtained from GeoNames ( 12) and stratified by: national wealth in terms of Gross National Income (GNI) per capita (<US$ 1045, US$ 1045-4125, US$ 4125-12 746, >US$ 12 746) ( 13); population size (<100K, 100K-500K, 500K-1M, 1M-5M, >5M); and Bailey’s Ecoregion “Domain” (Dry, Humid temperate, Humid tropical, Polar) ( 14). An additional 63 deliberately selected cities were added to this sample making the total 309 based largely on their reputation for policies which aim to make them "sustainable cities". The geographical distribution of the cities is shown in Fig. 1. The 64 cities of the WHO European Regionfrom the database, including 55 which were selected randomly, are listed in Table 1.
